content: @StPaulTim: you asked me to remind you that the next VUG is tomorrow and is about "Moving from Drupal 7 to Backdrop CMS" https://backdropcms.org/news/events/virtual-user-group-moving-from-drupal-7-to-backdrop-cms
Thanks Dragonbot :+1: botsnack
:donut: - donuts for everyone!

Just a reminder (in the General stream) that the next Virtual User Group meeting is tomorrow.
https://backdropcms.org/news/events/virtual-user-group-moving-from-drupal-7-to-backdrop-cms

Virtual User Group meeting starts in 5 minutes
http://bit.ly/backdrop-meetings

Video Conferencing, Web Conferencing, Webinars, Screen Sharing
Zoom is the leader in modern enterprise video communications, with an easy, reliable cloud platform for video and audio conferencing, chat, and webinars across mobile, desktop, and room systems. Zoom Rooms is the original software-based conference room solution used around the world in board, conference, huddle, and training rooms, as well as executive offices and classrooms. Founded in 2011, Zoom helps businesses and organizations bring their teams together in a frictionless environment to get more done. Zoom is a publicly traded company headquartered in San Jose, CA.
We are streaming at: YouTube - Virtual User Group Mar 3rd - Upgrading from D7

Thank you again. The term sanity check was mentioned several times. I think that’s what I need. It would be nice if someone with more experienced just laid eyes on my site. Is that a weird thing to ask?

@Justin Keiser - No, that's not a weird thing to ask. I thinks it's very much in line with the kind of thing we might do during the office hours tomorrow. We could actually do a screen share and look at your site and answer any questions you have.
If that doesn't work, we could schedule something custom. But, office hours is a natural time for this.
Well I wouldn’t want to monopolize the time.

@Justin Keiser - that a nice to thing to be concerned about. But, it's also a problem that might not need to be solved. By that, I am suggesting that you might be the only one that shows up, in which case "monopolizing the time" will not be an issue.

Also, there may be multiple mentors available - in which case someone could work with you while others assist anyone else that shows up.
I had a really tough night, so couldn't wake up in time this morning :disappointed: ...I'll watch the recording.

...I would be willing to have a look at https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/drupal-7-migration-blank-login-screen to figure out what the problem is, and whether it is generic to D7 -> Backdrop upgrades, or isolated to this site/case.
Thanks, I would love the mentoring but I'm not sure I want it recorded. I'm worried that the library might not like that for a lot of reasons.
I don't think that the office hrs thing will be recorded, and we can go on a private session, so that only people who actually need to have :eyes: on the site/code.
No, we would not record office hours - unless there was a specific reason for it.

https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/vug-contrib-modules-lightning-talks

I've thrown out an idea and a date/time. But, details are all subject to change based upon feedback.

The goal is a VUG where we do short 5-10 minute recorded lightning talks on contributed modules. I am looking for volunteers willing to present on their favorite contrib module (as maintainer or as user).
The goal is to generate video content that draws attention to underappreciated contrib modules.
How do you define "underappreciated contrib modules"?
Leaving that up to you. You can present on any module, but I recommend focusing on modules that aren't already widely understood/appreciated. But, that is not a requirement.
For example, I don't think there is an urgent need to present on Backup and Migrate or Webform, but either of them would be acceptable if you want.
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) - Which module do you want to present on?
I didn't really have any. I was just curious about definitions.

It's too bad that neither https://backdropcms.org/modules or https://github.com/backdrop-contrib allow one to specify the sorting.

Backdrop CMS contributed projects
Join the group at https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib to add your own! - Backdrop CMS contributed projects
We can look at https://backdropcms.org/project/usage for reference.
Proposed a different idea to allow for different timezones: https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/vug-contrib-modules-lightning-talks#comment-2489

@BWPanda - I think that we can definitely allow pre-recorded contributions (even encourage them), but part of the goal is to make it simple so that folks who don't usually create screencasts or videos don't have to worry about that part.

I'm think that we go with both. Pre-recorded AND live demos.
I think that there should be some "LIVE" component to the meeting. The other option is to schedule a second version of this at 10:00am Sydney (which is 5:00pm USA-Pacific).
Did I somehow delete this topic? Where did the messages go.
Oh, I accidentally muted the topic and it was no longer showing up in my streams.

Virtual User Group is tomorrow.

https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/jan-5-virtual-user-group-contrib-modules-lightning-talks

@Joseph Flatt and @Laryn are you still able to present. @BWPanda submitted a prerecorded session.
Is anyone else interested in doing a short demo or simply attending?
I believe that I should be able to attend @StPaulTim :+1:
Thanks for the reminder, yes I think that well work
Sorry, I can't attend. It's dinner time in our family.
We've started. https://bit.ly/backdrop-meetings-new
Just two of us for now, but feel free to join us anytime.
Are you starting early or did I read the time wrong?
No, the start time was 10:00am Pacific, unless I published it wrong somewhere.
Was looking at 1:00-3:00pm (Chicago / Minneapolis)
Hmm
Darn, it is wrong
Wil you be able to join us anytime in the next hour?
Yes, I'll try to join shortly

Here are links to the videos referenced during todays Virtual User Group:

preset & srcset_image
YouTube - YouTube

YouTube - YouTube
We hope to post 2 more videos from the user group today.
Coming soon
@BWPanda Thanks for the video. It's great. I'm still absorbing the Preset API, but it's good to know about the Srcset module. I had not used that yet, but will use it in the future.
Welcome. Hope you had a good discussion.
Looking forward to video.
Small group today. Four people.
Damn it, I also read the time wrong :sweat:
I've just finished watching both videos. Greta job guys :praise:
@StPaulTim ++
stpaultim GG (Karma: 32)
@BWPanda ++
bwpanda Props to you for all your hard work. (Karma: 28)
I just made my video public (it was previously unlisted) and made a (small) playlist of my Backdrop CMS videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLXxv-NVhSKFszhLRKGJ6wjS2VqZUbEl8K
@StPaulTim BTW, whatever happened to the Simpletest VUG?
Ahh, I dont' think I was ever able to schedule a date with someone that could present. (I had someone willing to present, but we didn't settle on a time).
We could try again.
Is anyone able and willing to do a presentation on how to write tests for Backdrop CMS (VUG)?
I volunteer @quicksketch :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
I would be happy to do a demonstration on how to run tests, or how to fix tests. But I don't really know how to write them. I just copy other tests :)
Same here :sweat_smile: ...I can tweak/update/fix, but have not tried writing one from scratch.

OK, there are three VUG topics in demand and I am both impatient tonight and a little over ambitious, so I am proposing 3 VUG meetings over next 6 weeks.

I am suggesting 10:00am (Pacific) time slot to best include US and Europe (Sorry @BWPanda )

Topics:
Feb 2 - Writing tests for Backdrop CMS
Feb 16 - Using Backdrop CMS for Multilingual Sites
March 2 - Command line tools for Backdrop CMS: B, Brush, & Drush

Please, help edit titles and descriptions in Google Doc and let me know if you are able to present at any of these. I suggested these topics, because I don't know much about any of them and want to learn.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QvW3x7uGGWM6ErMrAkYjTTcm4q1jynAp_4aipXkrS6I/edit

Next Three VUGs
Quick Proposal for Next 3 VUGs Time: TUESDAY 10:00am Oakland, Seattle 01:00pm Boston, Miami, Lima 03:00pm São Paulo, Buenos Aires 07:00pm Berlin, Prague 08:00pm Athens, Helsinki, Johannesburg 09:00pm Moscow, Istanbul WEDNESDAY 02:00am Manila, Singapore 03:00am Tokyo, Seoul 05:00am Sydney, ...
Also, I'd love to announce a few meetings in newsletter.
Thoughts?

Sad about timezones, especially if one of the talks features a module I maintain and am actively working on to release v1.0... But if the meetings are all recorded so I can watch them later then I guess its OK.
Speaking of which, wasn't the last VUG supposed to be recorded...?
Yes, I need to get it posted.
I'm discussing with @BWPanda to have the March 2nd VUG at 2:00PM (Pacific) so that he is able to participate in that one.
I think I understand the concept of writing tests and could help, but likely will still be at work at that time. Will check in once free.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QvW3x7uGGWM6ErMrAkYjTTcm4q1jynAp_4aipXkrS6I/edit

I am hoping that some of our multilingual community members will be able to help present. Is anyone interested?
I'll be attending.

VUG on the topic of Multilingual on Feb 16th.

Not sure yet, but the time of day in my timezone looks promising. (I won't be presenter, but might be around to answer questions.)
@indigoxela - Just having you there would be excellent.

Hi @StPaulTim thank you for organising... I will join the session, will start working on a new project soon: bring this one here from D7 to Backdrop (was Panopoly, so I will build in from scratch in Backdrop). Three languages (German, French, Italian) https://www.chx.ch/
And hey, the site's extranet already is on Backdrop. Altghout I can't give you access, unfortunately: https://extranet.chx.ch/

I am still looking for someone to do a presentation on Multilingual at this VUG. Does not have to be a structured presentation - could be an informal demonstration. February 16th.

https://backdropcms.org/news/events/virtual-user-group-multilingual-backdrop

@StPaulTim I could show the architecture of the aforementioned site. Translation of nodes, content for both languages (e.g. images, files), GUI etc.

Is anyone else available for next weeks VUG to show their multi-lingual work?

How about a VUG around B, with or without Drush?
I honestly don't know anything about B, which feels like a large gap. And I've learned I'm not alone.

@cellear (Luke McCormick) they were speaking about Brush: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/brush

backdrop-contrib/brush
Brush is a command line shell and Unix scripting interface for Backdrop CMS. - backdrop-contrib/brush

cellear (Luke McCormick) said:

How about a VUG around B, with or without Drush?

The next VUG is about Command Line tools in general, but I expect the focus to be on B. I have yet to try B myself and am looking forward to this discussion. @BWPanda is hoping to participate, but due to personal circumstances might not be able to attend. Hopefully, we'll have a backup scheduled.
https://backdropcms.org/news/events/virtual-user-group-command-line-tools

Thanks to everyone who participated in todays VUG. I think we had 9 participants at some point, including a couple of people that I was seeing for the first time.

By the time the after party was over, I was online for 3 hours. (@cellear and I partied for a while after the meetings were over).

Please don't expect a promised (during today's VUG) issue for adding additional arguments in t() function. Because, later I realized t() is just for interpreting UI strings based on whatever the translation file already has, it doesn't have anything with the time or author of specific translations. So in order to register the timestamp and author of each translation I probably need a custom module.

So in order to register the timestamp and author of each translation I probably need a custom module.

@Alan Mels That could be feasible: Do a hook_form_alter() on locale_translate_edit_form(), add your submission handler and write your infos to a custom database table - just a quick idea.

indigoxela said:

So in order to register the timestamp and author of each translation I probably need a custom module.

Alan Mels That could be feasible: Do a hook_form_alter() on locale_translate_edit_form(), add your submission handler and write your infos to a custom database table - just a quick idea.

Yep, I thought to take similar approach. Not a priority for now, but some time I'll get this done.

I'm interested in the command line tools VUG. I did quite a bit with Drush in Drupal 7, so feel this is a gap in my knowledge with backdrop. 10pm start is just about ok for me for an occasional thing.

Just watched the virtual user group about multilingual questions, thanks for the interesting presentation and discussion. @mazze.ch one question: Is it possible to not “translate” an image but it’s alt or title attribute?
@Olaf Grabienski from what I know... no:-(

@Olaf Grabienski it seems that this has been addressed in 7.x version of the file_entity module, and this D7 core issue was close 3 years ago: https://www.drupal.org/project/drupal/issues/2835135 ...when you get a chance, perhaps file an issue for this?
Thanks @klonos Here is a respective D8 issue: https://www.drupal.org/project/drupal/issues/1807692 (Guess who commented there .-)

10pm start is just about ok for me for an occasional thing.

Good news for you (I think), we are bumping the start time of the upcoming VUG forward by 1 hour to accommodate our presenter. See event listing for NEW times: https://backdropcms.org/news/events/virtual-user-group-command-line-tools

I don't think we will be able to stream it, because I don't have that set up.
oh, ok...so it was pre-recorded anyway. Look forward to watching! I've just been powering thru with Drush...need to learn about the other tools!

I’m lurking on YouTube
I got a notification on my iPad.
We are streaming: YouTube - Backdrop CMS - VUG - Command Line Tools

Thanks everyone for a great Virtual User Group. We had 11 participants, which is pretty good turn-out.

For those who missed it, it's recorded and available in the Virtual User Groups playlist for Backdrop CMS.

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLE6f8hiqhhJmpDymyzHFxa2aitcz1OB68

Virtual User Group Meetings
Share your videos with friends, family, and the world
WE got to get a better cover photo.

It was really great to see all the support for Backdrop Console (b). It's a double-edged sword though - now the pressure's on for me to finish the tests, get v1.0 released, then start work on adding everyone's favourite commands :smiling_face:

The other upside (I hope) is that if more people in the community understand where Backdrop Console is going and the work being done on it, the more opportunities there may be for folks to provide help (and/or useful feedback).

I found that really helpful, thanks! Like someone else said, I'd been wondering which of the three to spend time with. This made it clear that b (Backdrop Console? bc?) is the way to go. I've posted some requests in the issues. I'd be willing to have a go at trying to develop to help out, after I figure out how to debug command-line tools with PHPStorm.

We had 11 participants, which is pretty good turn-out.

I just found an email notification from Zoom that another person came to the VUG late and missed us entirely. That would have been 12.
Just finished watching this, thanks everyone for the overview!
